Service.title: Service
Service.description: Represents a tourism service offered on the platform.

features.description: List of features offered by the service.

pricing.description: Pricing details for the service (if applicable).

imageUrls.description: URLs of images associated with the service.

difficultyLevel.description: Difficulty level of the service (if applicable).

Booking.title: Booking
Booking.description: Represents a booking request made by a user.

serviceId.description: The slug of the service being booked.

serviceName.description: The name of the service being booked.

fullName.description: Full name of the person making the booking.

email.description: Email address of the person making the booking.

phone.description: Full phone number including country code.

date.description: Date for which the booking is requested (YYYY-MM-DD).

adults.description: Number of adults for the booking.

children.description: Number of children for the booking.

packageType.description: Selected package or duration for a service.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the booking was created.

WebsiteConfiguration.title: WebsiteConfiguration
WebsiteConfiguration.description: Represents the configuration settings for the website.

id.description: Unique identifier for the website configuration. Should only be one entry in the database.

websiteName.description: Name of the website, e.g. 'Essaouira Travel Services'.

websiteTagline.description: Tagline for the website, e.g. 'Your Premier Guide to Unforgettable Coastal Adventures'.

logoImageUrl.description: URL of the website logo image.

faviconImageUrl.description: URL of the website favicon image.

contactPhone.description: Contact phone number for the business.

contactEmail.description: Contact email address for the business.

googleAnalyticsId.description: Google Analytics ID for website tracking.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support a tourism booking platform, prioritizing security, scalability, and ease of debugging. Authorization Independence is achieved through denormalization where necessary. The structure supports QAPs by segregating data based on access needs and employing a consistent access model. The following structure ensures that rules are simple, robust and easily debuggable.

1.  `/services/{serviceId}`: Stores tourism service details.  No specific authorization concerns beyond ensuring the data is correctly formatted.  Listable to all users.

2.  `/bookings/{bookingId}`: Stores booking requests made by users. This collection can be secured to allow only authenticated users to create bookings and admins to read them. 

3. `/website_configuration/{documentId}`: Stores website-wide configurations.  This collection will hold a single document. No specific authorization concerns beyond ensuring that only authorized admin can modify this information.

This structure promotes clarity and simplifies security rules by avoiding hierarchical dependencies and segregating data with different access requirements. The design also facilitates future scalability and maintainability.
